page.title: 09 A HEAD TEACHER'S VIEW
page.content: Since taking up the post of head teacher of Dalmilling Primary School in 1983,I have found myself in a very challenging and stimulating job.I am, so to speak,{"at the hub of a very {important wheel"}in the life of the community.Very often,I am the first link the school has with the outside world,in particular,with parents and the local community. Despite the many problems of present day living,the people of our district very often display the happier side of life and generate feelings of warmth, sincerity and friendliness. In every school venture,undertaken by pupils or by staff,parents and friends willingly give their support,whether it is to a school based project or to other organisations,which assist less fortunate children in world-wide areas of deprivation.
